titleStmt.title: An entry from the Journals of Hensley Henson

sourceDesc.bibl: Edited from the manuscripts in the custody of Durham Cathedral Library.

body.p: The glorious weather continues. I received the Sacrament in the Cathedral. Budworth celebrated. The boys of the Grammar School communicated in large numbers.

I was motored out to Sacriston where I preached to a large congregation in the parish church. The occasion was a Church Parade of Territorials, Army Reserve, Ambulance, and Boy Scouts. Everybody was most attentive. I returned to the Deanery immediately after the service.
I attended Evensong in the cathedral.

We all motored to Pittington Church, where I preached to a very large congregation which had come together to keep a Harvest Festival. The acoustic qualities of this fine church appear to be excellent.
